Module org.example
Package org.example.bll

Class ProductBLL

java.lang.Object
org.example.bll.ProductBLL
public class ProductBLL
extends java.lang.Object
Contains the business logic part of the application that has to do with the product.
Since:
Apr 12, 2022

  • Constructor Details

    • ProductBLL

      public ProductBLL()

  • Method Details

    • findAll

      public java.util.List<Product> findAll()
      This function creates a list of products and calls the ProductDAO class function which gets all entries of the product table.
      Returns:
      A list containing all products in the table

    • insertProduct

      public void insertProduct​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String priceString, java.lang.String quantityString) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This function receives the fields entered by the user and tries to create a Product and call the database insert function. If this fails, it throws an exception
      Parameters:
      name - Name of product
      priceString - Product price
      quantityString - Product quantity
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Exception thrown if any of the fields are empty

    • findProductById

      public Product findProductById​(java.lang.String idString) throws java.util.NoSuchElementException, java.lang.NumberFormatException
      This function receives the value of the field of the id. If the field is empty, it throws an IllegalArgumentException. It searches in the database for the entry with the id and if no entry with that id is found, it throws an NoSuchElementException
      Parameters:
      idString - The id to be searched by, in string form
      Returns:
      The object of Type product with integer form of the id entered
      Throws:
      java.util.NoSuchElementException - Thrown when the query fails to find a matching entry
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the idString is empty
      java.lang.NumberFormatException

    • deleteProduct

      public void deleteProduct​(java.lang.Integer id)
      Calls the database layer method for deleting a table entry
      Parameters:
      id - Id in integer form

    • updateProduct

      public void updateProduct​(java.lang.String idString, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String priceString, java.lang.String quantityString) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Receives the id of the product to be updated and its new name, price and quantity in String form. It then tries to create an object with these values and to modify it in the database.
      Parameters:
      idString - The id for the product to be identified by
      name - New product name
      priceString - New product price
      quantityString - New product quantity
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the the fields are empty or when price or quantity cannot be converted to strings
